conclusion: Calculate the work done by the gas during the cyclic process using the area under the p-V diagram.
The p-V diagram is given in the figure.
Calculate the work done during each segment of the cycle and sum them up.
Identify the processes: A → B is an isobaric process.
Work done during an isobaric process A → B is W_AB = P * ΔV = P * (V_B - V_A).
From the figure, P_B = 4 x 10^5 Pa, V_A = 2 L, V_B = 4 L.
Calculate W_AB = 4 x 10^5 Pa x (4 L - 2 L) = 8 x 10^5 J.
Identify the processes: B → C is an isochoric process.
Work done during an isochoric process B → C is W_BC = 0.
Identify the processes: C → A is an isobaric process.
Work done during an isobaric process C → A is W_CA = P * ΔV = P * (V_C - V_A).
From the figure, P_C = 1 x 10^5 Pa, V_C = 5 L, V_A = 2 L.
Calculate W_CA = 1 x 10^5 Pa x (5 L - 2 L) = 3 x 10^5 J.
Calculate total work done W_total = W_AB + W_BC + W_CA = 8 x 10^5 J + 0 + 3 x 10^5 J = 11 x 10^5 J.
The work done by the gas on the surroundings during the cyclic process is 11 x 10^5 J.
